lines.text: Come out and take it, you dirty, yellow-bellied rat, or I'll give it to you through the door!
Say, where did you go last night? I stood in front of that cigar store so long they took me for an Indian!

[after Nolan speaks perfect Yiddish]
Nolan, what part of Ireland did your folks come from?

[laughs and then with a Yiddish accent]
Delancey Street, thank you.
I wouldn't go with that dame if she was the last woman on earth, and I just got out of the Navy.
I'd like to bury the hatchet - right in their thick skulls.
Your customer's idea of delicious and yours don't agree.
John Barrymore, The Mad Genius. I wonder what he's mad about.
You know what I think? I think he's copying Fredric March more and more every day. Don't you think so? He's my favorite though, except Joe E. Brown.

[to Skeets]
C'mom. I feel like bein' bored, and you can do the job better than anyone I know.

[to Sue]
I wish I could meet some big Spaniard with a lot of money. You know, I'm getting to the point where I ain't as particular as I used to be. I'll marry any guy that's got a collar and shirt, and if it comes to a pinch, marry him without the shirt.

[looking admiringly at Sue's legs as she climbs up the stairs of the el train]
Well, anyway, she's got a nice pair of pins.
Ah, I wouldn't go for that dame if she was the last woman on Earth and I just got out of the navy.
Why, if I thought you meant that...
Leave 'em alone. They're not botherin' you.
